title: BoJ set to keep rates on hold as markets seek signals on future hikes - FXStreet
summary:
Bank of Japan Maintains Interest Rate Steady for December

Date: December 18, 2023 | Source: FXStreet

On Thursday, the Bank of Japan (BoJ) decided to keep its short-term interest rate target in the range of 0.15%-0.25%, aligning with market expectations.

  • The decision marked the third consecutive meeting without a rate change.
  • Board member Naoki Tamura dissented, suggesting a rate increase to 0.5% due to rising inflationary risks.
  • Japan's economy shows moderate recovery, with private consumption and heightening inflation expectations.
  • High uncertainty remains regarding economic and price outlooks in Japan.

“The two-day Bank of Japan meeting ends Thursday with a widely expected hold.”

The Bank's policy will be closely monitored for implications on future interest rate hikes and the performance of the Japanese Yen.
newTitle: Bank of Japan Maintains Interest Rate Steady for December

title: SEBI bans YouTube influencer with 19 lakh-plus subscribers for investment scam; fines Rs 9.5 crore - The Times of India
summary:
SEBI bans YouTube influencer with 19 lakh-plus subscribers for investment scam; fines Rs 9.5 crore

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses the recent action taken by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to ban a popular YouTube influencer, who has over 1.9 million subscribers, due to involvement in an investment scam and outlines the imposed financial penalties.

  • SEBI has banned a YouTube influencer for his involvement in an investment scam.
  • The influencer had over 19 lakh subscribers on his channel.
  • A fine of Rs 9.5 crore was imposed on him.
  • This action is part of SEBI's crackdown on fraudulent investment schemes.
“This serves as a reminder that investment schemes must be legitimate and compliant with regulations.”

This incident highlights the ongoing scrutiny of influencer-led investment schemes and the importance of regulatory oversight in the financial sector.
newTitle: SEBI bans YouTube influencer with 19 lakh-plus subscribers for investment scam; fines Rs 9.5 crore

Morgan Stanley no longer sees Jan rate cut after hawkish Fed meeting - Investing.com
summary:
Morgan Stanley no longer sees Jan rate cut after hawkish Fed meeting

Publication Date: October 2023   |   Source: Investing.com

Morgan Stanley has revised its expectations regarding the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts, indicating a more cautious approach due to ongoing inflation concerns.

  • Morgan Stanley analysts now predict no 25 basis point cut in January 2025.
  • Expected future cuts are now projected for March and June 2025.
  • The Fed's hawkish tone reflects worries about inflation and economic policy changes.
  • Goldman Sachs has similarly adjusted its forecasts regarding interest rate cuts.
  • Traders are increasingly betting on a hold in January with a 91.1% probability.
“The Fed's hawkish turn appeared to reflect the incorporation of potential changes to trade, immigration, and fiscal policy by some members that led to a firmer inflation path and, in turn, a firmer policy rate path,” - Morgan Stanley analysts.

The recent revisions from Morgan Stanley indicate a shift in how analysts view the Fed's monetary policy in light of economic growth and labor market conditions.
newTitle: Morgan Stanley Adjusts Interest Rate Outlook Following Fed Meeting

title: Buy or sell: Vaishali Parekh recommends three stocks to buy today — December 19 | Stock Market News - Mint
Chalet’s next 1,000: acquisitions, new builds to fuel hotel chain’s aggressive expansion | Company Business News - Mint
Fed lowers rates but sees fewer cuts next year due to stubbornly high inflation By Reuters - Investing.com
summary:
Fed lowers rates but sees fewer cuts next year due to stubbornly high inflation

Publication Date: WASHINGTON Source: Reuters

The U.S. central bank has cut interest rates as expected, but future cuts depend on progress in addressing persistent inflation issues. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell emphasized a cautious approach moving forward, impacting market expectations.

  • The Fed cut the benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point.
  • Future rate cuts will be limited due to ongoing inflation concerns, particularly in housing.
  • Officials project that core inflation will remain above the Fed's target of 2% through 2025.
  • Only one 25-basis-point cut is currently reflected in market estimates for next year.
  • The economic outlook is clouded by potential changes from the incoming Trump administration.
"I think we're in a good place, but I think from here it's a new phase and we're going to be cautious about further cuts," said Jerome Powell.

In conclusion, while the Fed remains optimistic about economic growth, the interplay between monetary policy and potential new government policies will influence future rate decisions.
newTitle: Fed Lowers Rates Amidst High Inflation Concerns

Gold price plummets on Fed hawkish cut, traders eye Powell presser - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Prices Drop as Fed Chair Powell Indicates Cautious Monetary Policy

Date: October 2023 | Source: FXStreet

Gold price declines sharply as the Federal Reserve's less dovish outlook impacts the market, with emphasis on a prudent approach to monetary policy.

  • Gold prices trading between $2,600 and $2,610.
  • Jerome Powell discusses inflation risks being skewed to the upside.
  • The Fed projects a slow return to the 2% inflation target within one to two years.
  • Future limited rate cuts are expected through 2026, stabilizing the Fed funds rate at 3.4%.
  • Recent economic data indicates resilience despite higher interest rates.
“It could take one to two years for inflation to return to the 2% target.” - Jerome Powell

The article highlights the cautious stance of the Federal Reserve and its potential implications for future monetary policy, particularly regarding gold prices and broader economic indicators.
newTitle: Gold Prices Drop as Fed Chair Powell Indicates Cautious Monetary Policy

title: US Federal Reserve cuts interest rate by 25 basis points in key FOMC meet - The Times of India
summary:
US Federal Reserve cuts interest rate by 25 basis points in key FOMC meet

Date: 2023-10-03 Source: Financial News Agency

The Federal Reserve, in a key meeting of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), has decided to cut interest rates by 25 basis points. This move aims to stimulate economic growth amid concerns about inflation and global market instability.

  • The interest rate has been lowered from 5.25% to 5.00%.
  • This decision comes in response to signs of economic slowdown.
  • Officials express commitment to monitoring inflation closely.
  • The Fed indicates this cut may be a part of a series of adjustments throughout the fiscal year.
“This adjustment is necessary to support economic activity as we navigate through uncertain times,” said Chair Jerome Powell.

The Federal Reserve's decision is expected to have a significant impact on borrowing costs and consumer spending, potentially leading to a more robust economic recovery.
newTitle: US Federal Reserve Reduces Interest Rates by 25 Basis Points

title: 2 airlines oppose plan for reduced night flying time for pilots - The Hindu
summary:
2 Airlines Oppose Plan for Reduced Night Flying Time for Pilots

Publication Date: December 18, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The proposal to alter night flying regulations has met with opposition from IndiGo and Air India Group, citing potential operational impacts. Both airlines have expressed concerns over changes that could impact pilot fatigue management.

  • IndiGo rejected the suggestion to extend the night flying definition to include flying until 6 a.m., arguing it would have a severe operational impact.
  • Air India stated that changes could only be implemented after the introduction of a fatigue management system.
  • Airlines are also opposing an increase in weekly pilot rest from 36 to 48 hours, with IndiGo suggesting a staggered implementation.
  • Both airlines argue that expanding the night flying definition would lead to decreased night flying hours.
  • SpiceJet requested to defer rule implementation until March 2026, highlighting staffing concerns.
“The body repairs itself during a period of 2 a.m. to 5 a.m. when a person is sleeping...” - Captain Amit Singh, aviation safety expert.

The ongoing debate over night flying regulations underscores the challenges of balancing safety, operational efficiency, and pilot wellbeing in the aviation industry.
newTitle: Airlines Oppose Proposed Changes to Night Flying Regulations

title: Fed dot plot on focus as markets fully price in 25 bps interest-rate cut - FXStreet
summary:
Will the Fed dot plot signal a slowdown in interest-rate cuts for 2025?

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: FXStreet

The US Federal Reserve is expected to lower the policy rate by 25 basis points at its last meeting of 2024, with significant implications for the US Dollar and interest-rate outlook for 2025.

  • The Federal Reserve is widely expected to lower the policy rate by 25 bps at the last meeting of 2024.
  • Fed Chairman Powell’s remarks and the revised dot plot could provide important clues about the interest-rate outlook.
  • The US Dollar’s valuation could be impacted significantly heading into the Christmas holiday.
“While we think the Fed will remain keen on projecting additional policy easing for 2025, our view is that guidance regarding the pace of rate cuts will be more cautious going forward. This might be interpreted as a hawkish rate cut by market participants.” - TD Securities analysts

Expectation of revisions to interest rate, inflation, and growth projections could influence the USD’s valuation going forward.

The Fed is set to make its announcement at 19:00 GMT, followed by a press conference with Chairman Powell. Market reactions will depend on these details.
newTitle: Will the Fed dot plot signal a slowdown in interest-rate cuts for 2025?

Sebi board meeting: 10 key changes approved by the regulator that you need to know - The Economic Times
summary:
10 Key Changes Approved by Sebi Board Meeting

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: [Source Name]

In its latest board meeting, capital markets regulator Sebi approved a series of key measures aimed at protecting investor interest and improving various aspects of market regulations.

  • Stricter rules for SME IPOs
  • Review of merchant banker regulations
  • Relaxation in ESG reporting
  • Regulated entities responsible for use of AI
  • Simplified debt listing rules
  • Strengthening corporate governance
  • Amendment to mutual funds norms
  • Investor protection for REITs and InvITs
  • Regulations for startups
  • Alternative Investment Funds (AIFs)
“To prevent market manipulation, Sebi has introduced stricter surveillance mechanisms for trading platforms.”

This series of changes represents a significant shift in how the capital markets are regulated, emphasizing the protection of investors and the facilitation of market access.
newTitle: 10 Key Changes Approved by Sebi Board Meeting

title: Gold price dips ahead of key Federal Reserve decision - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Price Drops Over 1% Following Federal Reserve Rate Cut

Date: Recent Source: FXStreet

Gold prices fell sharply after the Federal Reserve announced a 25 basis point cut in interest rates, which traders perceived as hawkish. The Fed's projections indicate constrained rate cuts for the coming years.

  • Gold has fallen over 1% following the Fed's decision.
  • The Fed's dot plot indicates 50 basis points of rate cuts in both 2025 and 2026.
  • Traders are focusing on upcoming US GDP data and core PCE inflation metrics.
  • Gold prices have dropped to volatile ranges between $2,610 and $2,630.
  • Historical comparisons reveal minimal changes in the Fed's statements.
“Gold prices plunged sharply as traders assessed the cut as hawkish, with just 100 basis points of easing for the next two years.”

The outlook remains cautious as investors anticipate further economic indicators that could influence gold demand.
newTitle: Gold Price Drops Over 1% Following Federal Reserve Rate Cut

title: Stocks to Watch: Bank of Baroda, Asian Paints, Lupin, ITC, JSW Infra and more: Top stocks to watch out for on - CNBCTV18
summary:
Top Stocks to Watch Today: Bank of Baroda, Asian Paints, Lupin, ITC, and More

Date: December 19, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to watch in the market, focusing on significant movements and announcements from major companies.

  • Bank of Baroda: Approved issuance of bonds worth ₹10,000 crore for infrastructure and housing projects.
  • Asian Paints: Resignation of two senior management members without detailed announcements.
  • Lupin: Received FDA approval for generic HIV tablets, eligible for 180 days of exclusivity.
  • ITC: Increased stake in EIH and HLV; total stakes now at 16.13% and 8.11% respectively.
  • DOMS Industries: FILA to offload 4.57% shares in Doms Industries.
  • IOL Chemicals: Board to consider stock split on December 27.
  • Yasho Industries: Approval for issuance of equity shares at ₹1,900 each.
  • JSW Infrastructure: Secured ₹500-crore loan for development at Tuticorin Port.
  • Brigade Enterprises: Launched India's first net-zero residential project.
  • SBI: New Managing Director appointed.
  • Borosil Renewables: Approved production capacity expansion in India.
  • NITCO: Secured ₹105 crore in orders from Prestige Group.
  • FDC: Received USFDA approval for Cefixime 400 mg Tablets.
  • Gandhar Oil Refinery: Received EIR from USFDA after facility inspection.
"The promoters of NITCO have a 40-year-old relationship with the Razaak family of the Prestige Group, which exclusively buys its requirements from NITCO."

The market remains focused on these key stocks as various companies make strategic changes and announcements that could impact their future performance.

title: Hero Xpulse 200 4V Pro Dakar edition - Top five highlights - BikeWale
Sebi board approves stricter rules for SME market, including financial stability before IPOs - The Economic Times
summary:
Sebi Board Implements Stricter Guidelines for SME Market to Enhance Financial Stability

Publication Date: Wednesday, Source: Capital Markets Regulatory News

Capital markets regulator Sebi has approved new measures aimed at strengthening the SME IPO market, enhancing listing quality, and protecting investors' interests.

  • Companies must demonstrate an operating profit of Rs 1 crore in at least two of the last three financial years to list on SME exchanges.
  • Selling shareholders are limited to offloading a maximum of 50% of their holdings during the IPO.
  • The use of IPO proceeds is restricted, disallowing repayment of loans from promoters or related parties.
  • These reforms are designed to improve investor confidence and create a more transparent market ecosystem.
"These reforms are expected to boost investor confidence in SME IPOs, ensuring a healthier market ecosystem."

This initiative comes as SMEs have raised significant capital, with around 230 raising Rs 8,414 crore this year alone.
newTitle: Sebi Board Implements Stricter Guidelines for SME Market to Enhance Financial Stability

title: US Fed Meeting LIVE: Wall Street drifts higher ahead of Powell-led FOMC's final interest rate verdict for 2024 | Mint - Mint
summary:
US Fed Meeting LIVE: Wall Street drifts higher ahead of Powell-led FOMC's final interest rate verdict for 2024

Date: 18 Dec 2024

Source: LiveMint

The US Federal Reserve is set to announce its final policy decision for 2024, with expectations of a 25 basis points rate cut following a two-day meeting. Wall Street braces for impacts on the economy and market stability amidst ongoing shifts in U.S. economic strategy.

  • Jerome Powell leads the FOMC, which is expected to reduce the benchmark rate for the second consecutive time.
  • The last policy decision came after a significant political shift with the election of Donald Trump.
  • The Fed has already reduced rates by 50 basis points in previous meetings.
  • The market predicts further cuts in 2025 as inflation trends are closely monitored.
“If the data allow us to proceed a bit more gradually, that seems to be the prudent course of action,” said Powell.

In conclusion, the Federal Reserve's upcoming decision is crucial as it reflects broader economic trends and influences market conditions into the following year.
newTitle: US Fed Meeting LIVE: Wall Street reacts to interest rate decision

title: SEBI finally announces the setting up of performance validation agency called PaRRVA - Moneycontrol
Airlines oppose proposal on reduced night flying for pilots - The Hindu
summary:
Airlines oppose proposal on reduced night flying for pilots

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: The Hindu

IndiGo and Air India Group have opposed the DGCA’s proposal to extend the definition of night flying, citing operational impacts and the need for an advanced fatigue management system. Airlines are also resisting changes to weekly rest periods for pilots.

  • IndiGo rejected the proposal to raise the night flying definition to include 6 a.m.
  • Air India argues they need a fatigue management system before implementing changes.
  • Airlines delayed responses on proposed rest periods for pilots.
  • Proposals include the restriction of landings during night flying.
  • Aviation expert highlights the health implications of night flying on pilots.
“The body repairs itself during a period of 2 a.m. to 5 a.m. when a person is sleeping. But if the person is awake that repair is not happening, since it disturbs the circadian rhythm.” - Captain Amit Singh

The opposition from airlines raises concerns about pilot fatigue and operational safety, emphasizing the need for a comprehensive fatigue management system before new regulations are enforced.
newTitle: Airlines Challenge DGCA's Proposal on Night Flying for Pilots
